intro: Molubda, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and includes species such as Molubda arvensis and Molubda microcarpa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. They produce small, yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, similar to those of dandelions. Molubda species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
